question: Based on the provided evidence, answer the following question: What award did Svend Aage Faber receive in 1995?. If the evidence is insufficient to answer the question, return 'INSUFFICIENT_INFORMATION'.

content.source_1:
Title: The Electrotechnical Visionary: Svend Aage Faber's Illustrious Career and the Prestigious Knight of the Order of the Dannebrog

In the realm of Danish engineering, few names shine as brightly as Svend Aage Faber, a pioneering electrotechnician whose groundbreaking contributions left an indelible mark on the industry. Among his numerous accolades, one honor stands out: the esteemed title of Knight of the Order of the Dannebrog. This narrative delves into the life and achievements of Svend Aage Faber, weaving together the threads of his remarkable career to demonstrate the evidence supporting his receipt of this prestigious award. Born in Denmark in the early 20th century, Svend Aage Faber was destined for greatness. From a young age, he demonstrated a keen interest in the intricacies of electrical engineering, which would eventually become the foundation of his life's work. Faber's innate talent and dedication earned him a coveted spot at the Danish Technical University, where he honed his skills and developed a deep understanding of electrotechnology. Upon graduating, Faber embarked on a journey that would take him to the forefront of his field. He began his career at the Danish electrical company, Norsk Elektrisk & Brown Boveri (NEBB), where he quickly rose through the ranks due to his innovative approach and exceptional problem-solving abilities. Faber's expertise in electrical transmission and distribution systems soon made him a sought-after consultant, and his services were in high demand by prominent companies and government agencies. One of Faber's most notable achievements was his work on the development of Denmark's electrical grid. In the post-war era, the country's infrastructure was in dire need of modernization. Faber, with his vast knowledge of electrotechnology, played a pivotal role in designing and implementing a comprehensive electrical network that would meet the growing demands of the Danish population. His vision and expertise ensured a reliable, efficient, and safe supply of electricity, earning him widespread recognition and admiration. Faber's contributions to the field of electrical engineering extended beyond Denmark's borders. He was an active participant in international conferences and symposia, sharing his knowledge and collaborating with fellow experts to advance the global understanding of electrotechnology. His publications and research papers on topics such as electrical transmission, distribution, and safety protocols remain seminal works in the field, continuing to influence the development of electrical systems worldwide.
content.source_2: In the year 2041, the world was a vastly different place. Cities floated on water, robots had replaced most human jobs, and virtual reality had become indistinguishable from reality itself. But amidst all the rapid progress, one thing remained constant - the power of music. In a world where algorithms and AI-generated tunes dominated the airwaves, the Grammy Hall of Fame stood as a beacon of excellence, honoring the most iconic and enduring musical recordings of all time. And on a crisp autumn evening in 2041, the hall was abuzz with excitement as the latest inductees were about to be announced. Among the sea of tuxedos and evening gowns, one man stood out - Svend Aage Faber, a Danish engineer and electrotechnician who had spent his life bridging the gap between technology and art. His pioneering work in audio engineering had revolutionized the music industry, allowing for the creation of sounds and textures that were previously unimaginable. As the lights dimmed and the anticipation grew, the emcee took the stage to announce the latest additions to the Grammy Hall of Fame. The room fell silent as the names were read out, each one a testament to the power of music to transcend time and genre. And then, the moment of truth arrived. "And the final inductee into the Grammy Hall of Fame for 2041 is... Svend Aage Faber!" The room erupted into applause as Faber, resplendent in his tailored suit, made his way to the stage. As he accepted the award, Faber's eyes shone with tears of joy and gratitude. He thought back to the countless hours he had spent in his laboratory, tinkering with circuits and experimenting with sound waves. He thought of the countless musicians he had worked with, the legends he had helped to create. In his acceptance speech, Faber spoke of the symbiosis between technology and art, of how the two had come together to create something truly magical. He spoke of the responsibility that came with being a pioneer, of the duty to push the boundaries of what was possible. As the evening drew to a close, Faber's award was placed alongside those of the other inductees, a testament to the enduring power of music to bring people together and transcend the boundaries of time and space. And as the guests made their way out into the night, they couldn't help but wonder what the future held for this remarkable man, and for the music industry as a whole.
